page.title: 07HORSE RIDING IN MICKLEY
page.content:
In Mickley there are about 30 horses and ponies mainly kept for leisure riding. Average cost of keeping your own horse is Â£4 per week upwards on local farmers' fields. Most of the horses are wintered out and must also be given hay to eat during winter months which costs up to Â£2 per bale. This is supplemented with feeds of oats,barley,sugarbeet pulp,horse mix. Most owners of the horses are young girls age 8 years upwards. Horses are ridden regularly during the Summer months using local bridal paths and fields. During Winter horses are usually left in the fields to rest and only ridden during good weather. Most of the owners enter their horses in the annual Gymkhana.
{Mrs. Pat Middleton
